summary.name: (Stephen Chin) CD of Gorillaz's "Demon Days"
summary.description: My media object is a CD copy of the 2005 album "Demon Days" by the band Gorillaz. My copy is specifically the 2014 U.S. release of the album, which is mainly identified by the fact that it was released under Warner Bros. Records and Parlophone. Previous U.S. releases were released under Virgin Records and Parlophone.

overview.name: Best Buy store
overview.description: My copy of the "Demon Days" CD was purchased at a Best Buy in Brooklyn, New York around 2017. Best Buy is an electronics retail store chain that once supplied a decent selection of CD's for consumers to buy. However, in 2018, Best Buy announced that they would no longer supply and sell CD's, likely in response to the declining sales of CD's, the rise of music streaming, and the resurgence of vinyl records. Despite the retail chain's discontinued sale of CD's, it is worth noting their past role on the sale of CD's when CD's were the most popular physical music format.

overview.name: Rough Trade record store
overview.description: Rough Trade Records is an independent record label based in London, England and began in 1976 with a record store in West London. Rough Trade has since extended their operations, currently hosting a total of six record stores in the UK and one record store in New York City. Their one New York City store was formerly located in Williamsburg, but after the COVID-19 pandemic, they moved their location to Rockefeller Center in 2021. The new location in Rockefeller Center is much smaller in size than the former 10,000 square foot warehouse in Williamsburg, leading them to scale down the selection of items for sale. The location in Rockefeller Center sells vinyl records, CD's, cassettes, 45's, and other "Rough Trade"-branded merchandising.

overview.name: Barnes & Noble store (Union Square)
overview.description: Barnes & Noble is a retail book store that also sells vinyl records, CD's, and DVD's in select locations. Their music section can vary in size depending on the location, as some locations may choose to only sell vinyl records or may not have a music section at all. One of the largest Barnes & Noble stores in New York is located in Union Square, as it has around four floors filled with books, music, and games. The back of the first floor of the building hosts a spacious music section with a sizable selection of vinyl records, CD's, and DVD's.

overview.name: Barnes & Noble store (5th Avenue)
overview.description: Barnes & Noble is a retail book store that also sells vinyl records, CD's, and DVD's in select locations. Their music section can vary in size depending on the location, as some locations may choose to only sell vinyl records or may not have a music section at all. Barnes & Noble has a location in 5th Avenue in Manhattan, and it hosts a sizable music and movie section on the second floor. This area of the store sells a variety of vinyl records, CD's, DVD's, and board games.

overview.name: former Cinram manufacturing plant in Tuscaloosa, Alabama
overview.description: Cinram is a manufacturing company for various forms of optical media, including CD's, DVD's, VHS tapes, and cassette tapes. Cinram started in 1969, producing eight-tracks and cassette tapes, and only began manufacturing CD's in 1987. Warner Music Group entered an agreement with Cinram in 2003 where Cinram would be Warner Music Group's primary supplier for manufacturing and physical distribution of music. This agreement ended around the early 2010's, and since then, Warner Music Group has had various other unnamed suppliers manufacture and distribute their physical music. Cinram has since been acquired by Technicolor SA in 2015. One of Cinram's former manufacturing plants in Tuscaloosa, Alabama used to be owned by JVC, but after Cinram's purchase of JVC America in 2014, Cinram acquired the plant. Soon after their purchase of JVC, Cinram shut down the plant in Tuscaloosa in 2015, costing 100 workers their jobs.

overview.name: former Cinram manufacturing plant in Alsdorf, Germany
overview.description: Cinram is a manufacturing company for various forms of optical media, including CD's, DVD's, VHS tapes, and cassette tapes. Cinram started in 1969, producing eight-tracks and cassette tapes, and only began manufacturing CD's in 1987. Warner Music Group entered an agreement with Cinram in 2003 where Cinram would be Warner Music Group's primary supplier for manufacturing and physical distribution of music. This agreement ended around the early 2010's, and since then, Warner Music Group has had various other unnamed suppliers manufacture and distribute their physical music. Cinram has since been acquired by Technicolor SA in 2015. One of Cinram's former manufacturing plants in Alsdorf, Germany was acquired by the company from Time Warner in 2003. Cinram ended CD and DVD production in the Alsdorf plant in 2017.

overview.name: former Cinram manufacturing plant in Olyphant, Pennsylvania
overview.description: Cinram is a manufacturing company for various forms of optical media, including CD's, DVD's, VHS tapes, and cassette tapes. Cinram started in 1969, producing eight-tracks and cassette tapes, and only began manufacturing CD's in 1987. Warner Music Group entered an agreement with Cinram in 2003 where Cinram would be Warner Music Group's primary supplier for manufacturing and physical distribution of music. This agreement ended around the early 2010's, and since then, Warner Music Group has had various other unnamed suppliers manufacture and distribute their physical music. Cinram has since been acquired by Technicolor SA in 2015. One of Cinram's former manufacturing plants in Olyphant, Pennsylvania was originally owned by Specialty Records Coorporation before Warner Music Group, which was known as WEA Manufacturing at the time, purchased the plant around the late 1970's. The Olyphant plant was set to shut down its operations around 2018.

overview.name: former Cinram manufacturing plant in Richmond, Indiana
overview.description: Cinram is a manufacturing company for various forms of optical media, including CD's, DVD's, VHS tapes, and cassette tapes. Cinram started in 1969, producing eight-tracks and cassette tapes, and only began manufacturing CD's in 1987. Warner Music Group entered an agreement with Cinram in 2003 where Cinram would be Warner Music Group's primary supplier for manufacturing and physical distribution of music. This agreement ended around the early 2010's, and since then, Warner Music Group has had various other unnamed suppliers manufacture and distribute their physical music. Cinram has since been acquired by Technicolor SA in 2015. One of Cinram's former manufacturing plants in Richmond, Indiana began to end its operations around 2009.

overview.name: Trinseo
overview.description: A CD is composed of multiple different layers. The polycarbonate layer consists of a strong, transparent plastic and contains the encoded music data for the CD. Once a laser in a CD player scans and reads the lands and pits engraved on the polycarbonate layer, the data can be digitally processed to play the music on the disc. Even though my copy of the CD has a sticker on the back saying that the disc was made in Mexico, the label on the CD itself says that it was made in the U.S. I will assume that the information on the labeling of the CD itself is true and that the materials for the CD were from manufacturing plants in the U.S. I will be assuming that Trinseo is involved in the process of acquiring raw materials for the manufacturing of the CD. Trinseo is a company focused on the manufacturing of various types of plastics, including polycarbonates, and can operate as a supplier for other companies.

overview.name: Alcoa
overview.description: A CD is composed of multiple different layers. The metal reflective layer can be made out of either aluminum, gold, or silver and is used to reflect the laser back at the CD player. Assuming that the 2014 CD release of "Demon Days" is a standard CD, I am led to believe that the metal reflective layer of the CD is primarily made out of aluminum. I will be assuming that Alcoa is involved in the process of acquiring raw materials for the manufacturing of the CD. Alcoa is a company that focuses on the mining and production of aluminum and is stated to be one of the largest producers of aluminum.

overview.name: Vibrantz Technologies/Ferro Corporation
overview.description: A CD is composed of multiple different layers. The protective lacquer layer is a thin layer made out of lacquer, which is a clear, hard, shiny coating that can be applied to wood or metal. This thin layer is meant to protect the reflective metal layer from direct exposure to the environment, as contact with oxygen could lead to the oxidation of the aluminum in the metal layer, making the disc unreadable. I will be assuming that Vibrantz Technologies is involved in the process of acquiring raw materials for the manufacturing of the CD. Vibrantz Technologies, or Ferro Corporation, is a company that focuses on the production of color solutions and performance coatings for various materials.

location.address: 1789 Transelco Drive, Penn Yan, New York 14527

overview.name: Toray Plastics
overview.description: A CD is composed of multiple different layers. Many physical CD's will have an additional layer at the top of the CD for labeling purposes. This labeling surface can be made out of polyester, which consists of fiber materials. If the 2014 CD release of "Demon Days" has a polyester label on top of the CD, then I will be assuming that Toray Plastics is involved in the process of acquiring raw materials for the manufacturing of the CD. Toray Plastics is a subsidiary of Toray Industries that focuses on polyester films and polyolefin foam products. Toray Plastics is able to manufacture labeling film for various different items and objects.

location.address: 50 Belver Avenue, North Kingstown, Rhode Island 02852

overview.name: Styropek
overview.description: Many physical CD's are placed in a CD tray and packaged in a jewel case to secure the CD in place. Both the jewel case and CD tray are made out of polystyrene, which can take form as a solid or as a foamed material. Styrofoam is an example of the foamed material that polystyrene can be, but for the jewel case and CD tray, the focus is on the polystyrene's ability to be solid material. I will be assuming that Styropek is involved in the process of acquiring raw materials for the manufacturing of the CD's packaging. Styropek is a manufacturer of various polystyrene material, including expandable polystyrene.

overview.name: International Paper Company
overview.description: Most physical CD's include a paper booklet inside of the jewel case to provide additional information or artwork in relation to the album. The 2014 CD release of "Demon Days" includes a booklet including individual artwork for each song on the album. I will be assuming that International Paper Company is involved in the process of acquiring raw materials for the manufacturing of the CD's paper booklet. International Paper Company is a manufacturer of fiber-based paper products and offers various forms of packaging services. The company has a paper sheet plant located in Buffalo, New York that provides paper packaging and paper sheets.

overview.name: Warner Music Group headquarters
overview.description: Warner Music Group began as Warner Bros. Records in 1958, in reaction to film studio Warner Bros. wanting a record label division.

location.address: 1633 Broadway, New York City, New York, U.S.

overview.name: Warner Music Czech Republic (f/k/a Parlophone Music Czech Republic)
overview.description: Parlophone Records has existed for as far back as 1896 when it was referred to as the Carl Lindström Company. Parlophone Records was founded in Germany, but had a sizable presence in the UK. The record label also had branching operations in locations such as the Czech Republic and Portugal. In 2013, Warner Music Group acquired Parlophone Records and absorbed their corresponding subdivisions, including Parlophone Music Czech Republic. Parlophone Music Czech Republic has since been renamed as Warner Music Czech Republic and continues to be included under the list of global affiliates for Warner Music Group as recent as November 2023.

overview.name: Warner Music Portugal Ltd. (f/k/a Parlophone Music Portugal Lda)
overview.description: Parlophone Records has existed for as far back as 1896 when it was referred to as the Carl Lindström Company. Parlophone Records was founded in Germany, but had a sizable presence in the UK. The record label also had branching operations in locations such as the Czech Republic and Portugal. In 2013, Warner Music Group acquired Parlophone Records and absorbed their corresponding subdivisions, including Parlophone Music Portugal Lda. Parlophone Music Portugal Lda has since been renamed as Warner Music Portugal Ltd. and continues to be included under the list of global affiliates for Warner Music Group as recent as November 2023.

Warner Music Group entered an agreement with Cinram in 2003 where Cinram would be Warner Music Group's primary supplier for manufacturing and physical distribution of music. overview.description: subsidiary of Warner Music Group

location.address: 777 S Santa Fe Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90021

overview.name: Parlophone Records headquarters
overview.description: Parlophone Records has existed for as far back as 1896 when it was referred to as the Carl Lindström Company. Parlophone Records was founded in Germany, but had a sizable presence in the UK. The record label also had branching operations in locations such as the Czech Republic and Portugal. In 2013, Warner Music Group acquired Parlophone Records and absorbed all of their corresponding subdivisions. Parlophone Records continues to operate as a subsidiary of Warner Music Group today, with their headquarters being located in London, United Kingdom. The record label continues to represent a handful of artists today, including Gorillaz, Blur, Coldplay, Turnstile, Iron Maiden, Slipknot, and David Guetta.
